intro: Sutera grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered sutera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its showy, pale yellow or white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often woody and branched. Sutera grandiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive blooms and tropical appearance.
